subject: Re: Philosophic: Stress Testing with jUnit
msgSnippet: ... Yes. Depending on what kind of system stress/load testing you are doing, you may find JMeter useful. You can get it at
messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., "Alexander Zynevich" <java@t...> wrote:
> Does jUnit meet requirements of stress testing? As for me stress
> testing is testing in conditions which are very close
> to "production". Is it possible to call such a testing as "unit"
> testing? In most cases stresstests are to figure out how set of
> components works, this set may be distributed between server and
> client, between peers, and so on... but jUnit fundamently works on
> one machine. I think PRIMARILY jUnit is for testing of classes or
> small sets of components. Am I right?

Yes. Depending on what kind of system stress/load testing you are
doing, you may find JMeter useful. You can get it at
http://jakarta.apache.org/jmeter/index.html

-TJ
